inventory: Cairo, Institut Français d'Archéologie Orientale, s. inv.
bibliography: first mentioned by B. Bruyère, Fouilles de l'Inst. franç. d'archéol. orient. du Caire, 20.2 (1952), p. 25; cf. P. Mertens, OLP 6-7 (1975-1976), p. 397-409 (no. 50); K.A. Worp, JJP 28 (1998), p. 216-217.
author: anon.
contents: scholia on Od. 9.1-3 and 39-40, narrating some related stories.
propernames: Odysseus; Zeus; Alkinoos; Ilion; Kikones (2); Kyklôpes; Polyphêmos; Poseidôn.
mythological: Odysseus; Zeus; Alkinoos; Ilion; Kikones (2); Kyklôpes; Polyphêmos; Poseidôn.
statepreservation: 9 lines broken off to the left (the final one being a salutation), with "margins" at top and bottom.
lectionalsigns: continuous line drawn around the text of the final line (salutation); unidentified trace of ink in the top margin.
hand: small cursive, rapid and regular, keeping the lines straight; seems too proficient to be a school hand (as suggested by Worp, p. 217, n. 23).
